intro: Indigofera mupensis subsp. abercornensis, commonly known as the Abercorn indigo, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
